4552BDB1B86B4FC5929A1656BE6CA5AD.description: Prepare and present a report on the work study experience including aspects such as: expected hours of work, dress code, job description, employer expectations, employer evaluation process, absent and late policies, personal relationships, problem solving and communication.

A402F367BCDB4762B174E5FF5F21C91B.description: Design and participate in an exit interview with the workplace.

BC552B8787B44A0E989BC1EE7F91F9AF.description: Reflect and report on the work experience including but not limited to hours of work, personal relationships, employer expectations, evaluation criteria, and overall personal performance.

C5C4A3A8AF0A41589E2E9B2372B16543.description: Identify and report on essential skills and employability skills as they relate to a work environment.

1CE43CD319D042DCA81068117BA34426.description: Establish standards of work performance acceptable to the student and employer.

E9508E457BE349FAB1E450979283264D.description: Gain an opportunity for the development of entry-level workplace skills that may lead to sustainable employment in the photography industry.

D95EF2AEEF5F44B5814496875DA5170B.description: Develop an awareness of career opportunities in Saskatchewan and beyond.

CF4C2204B7E84217AA25B17E156CBBED.description: Gain experience in the world of work in the photography industry to make more informed career choices by expanding career research and exploration beyond the classroom.

C7852DA4BBF849AC92FA136F4EA72C7A.description: Practise effective interview techniques based on established guidelines (e.g., the greeting, the exchange, and the parting).

D62784C8A14E4DEFB7E70F32C64D0C01.description: Develop a resumé and portfolio that can be forwarded to a potential employer.

5F98B91B038B474E8ADC2495F25E0ECE.description: Discuss effective and positive verbal and non-verbal communication in the workplace.

D16E5429C8F347DE8EDCA9B64E7859BC.description: Brainstorm factors that may affect workplace performance.

8EC4FCD907904F55B3DAE6526FCFFA2B.description: Obtain a list of roles and responsibilities of the workplace.

B55E978D2F0A4945B0691B7AC7F4E6A3.description: Recognize how school-based skills development will be used to meet workplace expectations.

288D62F9396C4CACAA5D6425DA59505C.description: Investigate the costs of starting a photography business such as buying equipment, obtaining a business licence, paying taxes, pricing your product, and purchasing insurance.

3F650E962C154D19A902E14764392677.description: Analyze the differences between photojournalism, social photography (e.g., weddings, parties), portrait photography, assignment photography and stock photography and create a statement about your personal business preference.

CBE3D30227B6446491DB77570A0C74F1.description: Identify and interview an entrepreneur to investigate how he/she started out in business and what advice he/she can provide

1EBB6EBBB8E94248B94761CCB4B1E6C6.description: Develop required skills to operate a variety of photographic businesses.

53B2400B70DF4D8F9220A44F23D1C7DD.description: Explore how various poses create emphasis

ACD6020B8C564683BB4CA848DA0BB0F0.description: Explore how various poses create emphasis

D458BCF0D5534E09B0ADAED9CCF2D3D5.description: Investigate the effects of lighting on subjects (e.g., supplementary lighting, reflectors).

75F6548709A54471A3FC367E4BBA5D1E.description: Develop and demonstrate techniques employed by portrait photographers.

874BB01E201E4E14B8813593E5B55314.description: Create an assessment of the exhibition through personal reflection and feedback from others.

97062E2FC2C3411F8F49C8D14C383917.description: Engage classmates and/or the public in a display of personally created photographs.

3565D15FF95248ADA9CB6774B670BA38.description: Create a personally satisfying photography presentation through the use of matting, mounting, and/or framing

4BDEA4E2992241249600787A517EA911.description: Create a plan for an exhibition including time, space, intended audience, and purpose.

F2C6FE99DE454324B61E09F850905E46.description: Create and display a digital or print gallery of completed images along with photographer’s notes and descriptions of the process involved.

A63B43B629154D71A80FCC5695BBED5F.description: Manipulate an image to alter the appearance (e.g., colour, apparent age, masking).

682F77EE667C4154806AB1D9A72B4299.description: Apply software/editing effects to create personally satisfying images.

B212C2DD29714DDA9BC728FBD7D356EE.description: Demonstrate increasing expertise using software to perform advanced manipulation of digital images

81EB869A724546B58AF409F77D3D404C.description: Investigate the ownership rights of personal work and how to protect and sell usage rights of personal work using techniques such as watermarking.

4ADEBE9E3A5B483799A15006B2823E8A.description: Explain and support a personal stance on intellectual property.

2B6ECADA6AEC4940996B57B2106F2C8A.description: Collect and categorize a number of articles from various sources regarding intellectual property that reflect opposing points of view.

3D1DC7B7F9CD4194BDAE2BD03750907F.description: Utilize the Canadian Intellectual Property Office to distinguish between copyright, a patent, and an industrial design, and identify some common examples pertaining to photography.

DF0D1D280DFE408A9DDEF16431F9D51E.description: Identify through research the positive and negative aspects of creative, artistic, and intellectual works receiving ownership protection.

9CC2DA563419422DB2A9793666F716C3.description: Apply advanced editing effects to create images such as: selection tools, masking, brushes, vignetting, dodging and burning, temperature adjustment.

C5A26DABBCE848B99C8B071C057A4212.description: Manipulate original images to enhance their appearance.

6BA1163B7C4C45D0BBEC97162194DF0D.description: Demonstrate increasing expertise using software to improve digital images.

5EB6F4012A8B469C8D22BCEAD289F399.description: Demonstrate how to set a custom white balance for specific locations, light sources, and conditions.

AB0F98EA59694C4E889F54CC78E15F87.description: Adjust the colour balance on a camera to achieve different visual impacts in different lighting situations to represent what you see.

4CE0EDAD70634A9290B001804F0AEC37.description: Investigate how changes in white balance can be manipulated to produce different effects.

6448B687E99E42C6A4E60867B47C7547.description: Optimize colour values when capturing an image.

5170768263FA4263A1B9C62CE213D444.description: Demonstrate the use of mixed lighting and fill-in flash.

B7E4DF5BC3C148C0832F7622E87809FC.description: Show the effects of manipulating flash through power settings (e.g., full power, half power).

68AF7EF7E1364B16BA3335F6A2172E0A.description: Demonstrate the effects of changing the flash technique (e.g., bounce, using diffusers, or using coloured gels on the flash).

F5A28EBEC3914030A46A4DB8B973D8D6.description: Compare images that demonstrate the effects of using an electronic flash.

59AE68A0A8564B4E803E01FC1ECE8EFB.description: Create images demonstrating the use of an electronic flash.

818DECC234D94F3C86CA98DD22E11723.description: Identify local opportunities for being paid as a freelance photographer.

0119BDF2D10D441AA1C7835037FA2792.description: Investigate the career opportunities for professional photographers.

5997A8899AC14E93862E536602D7BA8A.description: Investigate programs offered by universities and technical institutes in photography.

CED2D588B2EF4435A90B85DBAF6C7956.description: Identify specific examples of occupational skills required in photography occupations.

31BDE90381FA48C29AC58535670EC9BB.description: Explore and evaluate the career training and occupational opportunities in the field of photography in Saskatchewan, Canada, and globally, including post-secondary education programs.

E518CF9FD5374585A919DA0046751583.description: Manipulate light to change the resulting image through the use of tools such as reflectors, diffusers, coloured gels, and additional light sources.

1708E3CFC24A47F285C234EF757D318A.description: Explore and demonstrate the effect of changing: the direction of light on a subject, the quality of light on a subject including diffuse light, natural light, colour, temperature, and types of light sources, the quantity of light on a subject

2B97C42A77044484871EF1DB3B533AC3.description: Create a series of images showing the effect of the quality, quantity, and direction of light.

D2D4C7C5E4654F808CD20908DA283A86.description: Understand and illustrate, through providing examples, the concept of how a resulting image is affected by focal length and/or format size.

B522C96B6A2146B2A274A93DBFD78C08.description: Demonstrate the change in image as a result of using a variety of lenses (e.g., fisheye, wide angle, telephoto).

16DFD754BB43405081F68A536E9A9DCA.description: Illustrate how different lenses affect an image (e.g., fast versus slow, zoom versus prime).

9F0124C49A9D4CC182F92FF7935AEE65.description: Demonstrate an understanding of selecting various lenses and focal lengths to create a variety of effects on the image.

30BAAE77F1124DE88A37627A438C68AE.description: Produce a series of images to show the apparent change in depth of field resulting from a change in focal length.

74EBB32A11B14FAAA7B1D4E8B16581D0.description: Create a series of images to demonstrate how perspective is changed by altering the camera position relative to the subject.

6B0E5A4B48274525B5EA392FB7B063F3.description: Show the effects on a series of images produced by changing the focal length (i.e., zoom).

C1849755E14D40FFB411975FA2DA5898.description: Analyze the effect of focal length on the image.

671B5C659781428D97213D4CFB991659.description: Recognize when normal rules of compostion can be broken.

5698557AC1C64C63AC2C770D72796F8D.description: Create images demonstrating aspects of composition such as rule of thirds, negative space, lines, contrast, and colour

68F2AFEF8AF540BA80A2EBCF13531448.description: Visualize and describe or illustrate techniques to compose a photograph.

BA891A6F32324E3C96DF5F9265F730DE.description: Critique various photos on their compositional merit.

21A1DF7F16AA4A5FBF24BFADB755EA78.description: Research and define elements of photographic critique.

805291366BAA44778E4F3EA7231F5150.description: Create images through demonstration of visualization and composition.

7C79200F46C84EEB9AB2D1A2F6C047D2.description: Identify environmentally sustainable ways to use and dispose of equipment and accessories such as batteries and chemicals.

18A6215F380545F1AB4FC5AC8441EB0A.description: Create a list of safety practices to protect both equipment and self when using photographic equipment such as cameras, flash, external lighting.

46908DFED3594BE0BD42FC2EAD60C80B.description: List safety issues and produce a plan for personal safety when taking photographs.

08AA1BEC991E48D18F6F364B39BEB119.description: Describe safe and sustainable practices connected to the field of photography.

E8C1D4B061D24CB392C5694BE8C9ADA5.description: Create a log of camera settings which includes a personal assessment of each image based on the above criteria.

6EB2C7ED25B143EA9F490C4E9F5ABFC9.description: Consistently create quality images that are in focus, demonstrate basic composition rules, and have a clear focal point.

84A2647B1EFA4CDCA12C78E96E427D6E.description: Consistently create quality images through control of the exposure triangle.

D19FCC31DA0F4738ADD1FD2121FB10CE.description: Demonstrate proficiency of image capture through manipulation of camera settings.
